result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcelo M. Roman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 3rd Degree Sexual Assault, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.

Sex offender registry program compliance through State of WI for a period of 15 years; Defendant may have NO CONTACT w/anyone under 18 years unless approved by department; DNA sample and surcharge; If federal government deports defendant, he may not be in the United States without proper identification; If defendant returns to United States, he must report w/in 72 hours to DOC in Wausau, WI; Defendant must report any change in deportation status; w/hin 24 hours of release from ICE within the US, defendant must report that release to WI DOC.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called: 10:07am
State appears by ADA T.Wetzsteon; Defendant appears in person/in custody and with Attorney Amanda Ley; Interpreter Teresa Berger sworn and interprets for defendant.

Attorney Ley notes no changes/corrections to PSI; Neither party has testimony or witnesses.
Argument on sentence recommendation by both counsel.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT makes rulings.
COURT ORDERS: 
Ct. 3>> 7.5 years TOTAL: 2.5 years incarceration and 5 years ES.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC; Sex offender registry program compliance through State of WI for a period of 15 years; Defendant may have N/C w/anyone under 18 years unless approved by department; DNA sample and surcharge; If federal government deports defendant, he may not be in the United States without proper identification; If defendant returns to United States, he must report w/in 72 hours to DOC in Wausau, WI; Defendant must report any change in deportation status; w/hin 24 hours of release from ICE within the US, defendant must report that release to WI DOC.
COURT questions State re: payment of costs through prison wages - State is not aware of any requirements.

>>Credit for 460 days of time already served.
>>Defendant is not eligible for either SAP or CIP.
>>Both parties keep copies of PSI and COURT directs counsel re: confidentiality.

COURT remands defendant to the Marathon County Sheriffs Department for transport to WI State Prison System.
